results.title: Kakadu man
results.creator_credit: Bruce Moir, Tristram Miall and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Kakadu is the jewel of the country’s national parks and the home of the Gagadju people. “Kakadu Man” is the story of Bill Niedjie, the traditional custodian of this land - a role passed down to him through countless generations. In 1979 he gave the land to the people of Australia. Translated through the use of actors and puppet characters, and scenes of Kakadu, “Kakadu Man” unfolds into a sensitive and often humorous portrait, weaving together the figurative and the abstract, the past and the present. The message of this important documentary is of vital concern to people everywhere.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Moir, Tristram Miall and Film Australia

results.title: Seduction: the cruel woman
results.brief_description: This video is based on two classic s/m novels; “Venus in Furs”, and “The Story of O”. “Venus in Furs” portrays the insatiable desire of one man to submit to one very cruel woman - indeed his love-ridden slavishness is so demanding that it takes a considerable toll on her. This is one sub-plot of this video. Wanda is the cruel woman, and through the course of the video, all Wanda’s primary relationships change, and yet the show, the performance art of sado-masochism, goes on. English subtitles.

results.title: Charade
results.brief_description: A Parisienne (Audrey Hepburn) finds her husband murdered. Four strange men are after her, and she is helped by a handsome stranger (Cary Grant)… but is he a hero, spy or a murderer? A mammoth audience teaser bursting with multiple identities, smart Parisian settings and Henry Mancini music. The song Charade was nominated for an Academy Award, lyrics by Johnny Mercier.

results.title: Up the organisation (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Peter Riding and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Robert Townsend has unconventional views on how business should be run. he gives his views on such topics as the Chief Executive, the Personnel Department, Computers Management, Consultants, the Public Relations Department, the Board of Directors, Getting In and Getting On and People.

results.title: Standing Up for Joe (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A film about conductive therapy in Hungary. A little used but successful program for cerebral palsy. Shows parents of young children going to Hungary and becoming involved in a successful program leading to some level of independence for the child.
results.description: A film about conductive therapy in Hungary. A little used but successful program for cerebral palsy. Shows parents of young children going to Hungary and becoming involved in a successful program leading to some level of independence for the child.

results.title: The Fallen idol
results.creator_credit: Carol Reed, David O. Selznick and London Film Productions
results.brief_description: An ambassador’s small son nearly incriminates his friend the butler in the accidental death of his shrewish wife. A near-perfect piece of small-scale cinema, built up from clever nuances of acting and cinematic technique. Written by Graham Greene. Stars Ralph Richardson. Rated: PG

results.title: Seeing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Seeing involves both the eyes and the brain. The development of seeing and the beginning of visual awareness are discussed. An eye specialist explains how the eye works and stresses the importance of the early detection of eye problems. Eye tests are demonstrated and the problems associated with glasses discussed. We examine common childhood ailments and injuries, parents talk about their visually impaired children and some advice is offered by an early childhood specialist.

results.title: Fighting Arthritis: The Importance of Self Management
results.brief_description: Fighting Arthritis speaks to both the health professional and the lay person. Through the words of people with arthritis, spouses, doctors and health promotion personnel, a dynamic picture emerges of how we can all benefit from the self management approach to arthritis.

results.title: Betty Cuthbert
results.creator_credit: Kathy Mueller, Pamela Vanneck, Ron Saunders, Coote and Carroll and Roadshow Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
This moving drama series on important figures from Australia’s past brings history to life. Betty Cuthbert, the “Golden Girl”, held a very special place in the affections of the sporting world because of her immense courage, optimism and innate modesty. Betty competed in 3 Olympic Games during her 13 year career as the world’s greatest female runner.

results.title: Lottie Lyell
results.creator_credit: Ben Lewin, Pamela Vanneck, Ron Saunders and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
This moving drama series on important figures from Australia’s past brings Australian history to life. Lottie Lyell was one of Australia’s most successful actresses. Although she often played the damsel in distress in her early films, Lottie was no helpless heroine in real life. As well as starring in her films, she worked behind the cameras as script writer, art director, costume designer, editor and business manager. She was part of an excellent team with Raymond Longford, Australia’s best known silent film director with whom she had a long and enduring relationship.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ben Lewin, Pamela Vanneck, Ron Saunders and Film Australia
